meta.description: Educational content for FDs, RDs, and Mutual Funds (SIP) focusing on hidden charges, tax rules, and smart checks.

fee_decoder.name: Premature Withdrawal Penalty
fee_decoder.insight: If you break an FD before maturity, banks deduct 1% from the *applicable* rate (the rate for the period the FD actually ran), not just the contracted rate.
fee_decoder.action: Avoid breaking FDs. Use a 'Loan Against FD' or Overdraft instead (usually 1-2% interest above FD rate) to save the penalty.

fee_decoder.name: RD Delayed Installment Penalty
fee_decoder.insight: Missing an RD date is expensive. Banks charge a penalty for every day/month of delay and may even reduce the final interest payout.
fee_decoder.action: Set the RD deduction date 2-3 days *after* your salary date, not on the exact day.

fee_decoder.name: TDS (Tax Deducted at Source)
fee_decoder.insight: If total interest across all FDs in one bank exceeds ₹40,000/year (₹50k for Seniors), bank deducts 10% TDS automatically.
fee_decoder.action: Submit Form 15G (Age <60) or 15H (Age >60) in April every year to stop this if your total income is below taxable limits.

smart_checks.explanation: Banks often auto-renew FDs for the same tenure. If rates have dropped, you get locked into a lower rate.
smart_checks.recommendation: Set maturity instruction to 'Auto-Credit to Savings Account' so you can decide the best new tenure manually.

smart_checks.term: Mode of Operation: Either or Survivor (E or S)
smart_checks.explanation: If holding usually 'Jointly', both signatures are needed for everything. In 'E or S', either survivor can manage it easily.
smart_checks.recommendation: Always choose 'Either or Survivor' for joint FDs with spouse/parents.

fee_decoder.name: Expense Ratio (The Commission)
fee_decoder.insight: This is the annual fee paid to the fund house. 'Regular' plans pay commissions to agents forever. 'Direct' plans save you this money.
fee_decoder.action: Check your fund name. It MUST say 'Direct Plan'. Over 20 years, a Regular plan can eat 20% of your profits.

fee_decoder.name: Exit Load
fee_decoder.insight: A penalty for leaving early. Most equity funds charge 1% if you withdraw before 365 days.
fee_decoder.action: Do not use Equity SIPs for money needed in < 1 year. Use Liquid Funds (Zero Exit Load).

fee_decoder.name: Stamp Duty
fee_decoder.insight: A tiny government levy deducted upfront from every SIP installment.
fee_decoder.action: Non-negotiable. Just be aware why your invested units are slightly less than the amount paid.

tax_decoder.name: Short Term Capital Gains (STCG)
tax_decoder.insight: Profit booked before 1 year is taxed heavily at 20% + Cess.
tax_decoder.strategy: Avoid redeeming equity funds before 1 year unless it's an emergency.

tax_decoder.name: Long Term Capital Gains (LTCG)
tax_decoder.insight: Profits over ₹1.25 Lakh in a financial year are taxed at 12.5%.
tax_decoder.strategy: Tax Harvesting: You can book profits up to ₹1.25L every year to pay zero tax, then reinvest.

red_flags.reason: Dividends are now fully taxable at your income slab. Growth option is much more tax-efficient.
NFOs at ₹10 NAV are not 'cheaper'. They have no track record.
red_flags.action: Stick to existing funds with >5 year track records.

document_checklist.note: Critical. Check if nominee name matches their ID proof exactly.
For SIP auto-debit. Ensure signature matches bank records to avoid rejection.
Check strictly on CVL KRA website. 'KYC Registered' is mandatory.
